intro: Fumaria saxatilis, commonly known as the rock fumewort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in mountainous regions. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with fine hairs. Fumaria saxatilis is characterized by its slender, branching stems and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
